review_title: Excellent treatment for patients who have few other bad options. Lots of training available, if you want them.
pros: The  therapy, groups, Adjunctive activities--always something available  to help every patient.  Psychiatry is active in the care, and usually knows the patients well.
cons: Some staff and nurses that are burned out, but overall people try their best.  Most people care about their patients and it shows.

pros: Good staff and nice campus
cons: Management has poor communication and lack of follow through.

pros: Coworkers, close commute, opportunity to work bonus shifts
cons: Upper management is nonexistent, unethical standards, extreme lack of accountability for staff and patients

pros: Love working with the patients and staff
cons: Wish the pay was a little bit more

review_title: Good company working on improving culture, employee accountability, and productivity.
pros:
Great coworkers. 
Infrastructure Investment.
Mission.
Employee empowerment.
cons: Regional competition for available personnel personnel and increased compensation pressure.

pros: The only thing great here are the staff nurses and ancillary staff members. Middle and upper management have no compassion or care for patients and even less for the trench workers.
cons: Punitive! Persecutory, lack leadership! Too many chiefs not enough indians! Pardon the political incorrect statement,.

pros: None. They use you and never show appreciation. Pay is subpar and health benefits are horrible. Nurses try to work together and aides work hard too.
cons: Its not a job for a nurse who wants to grow in their skills. Look elsewhere. There also is a nurse manager that creeps on female staff. Stay far away.

pros: Working with the patients at EH was very fulfilling
cons: Management just does not care whatsoever about the safety or well-being of their employees. They fire staff left and right and turnover is so high. Management pressures their subordinates to comply with new guidelines to cover their own tails and do not speak up on behalf of their staff.

pros: Interesting hospital history and positive former reputation
cons: Current reputation, severely under staffed in all departments and desperate. Behaviors that used to result in discharge are now allowed to maintain billing. Meals skimpy and poor quality. Dirty environment. Where did housekeeping go?

pros: Transformative campus revitalization program scheduled to be complete in 2021 that will provide patients with a state-of-the-art physical environment to compliment their evidence-based treatment plan.
cons: Rapid change of environment and culture for quality goal achievements.

pros: Patients are trying to get help.
cons: Management does not value employees.

pros: Nice benefits and great treatment program for the patients. Employees are very nice.
cons: Administration is not so well, they should involve themselves more with the community of the hospital.

review_title: favorite place to work with pros and cons
job_title: Cna/Mental Health Tech in Pottstown, PA
pros: the  staff are truely amazing and truly care about their  patients. the atmosphere keeps you on your toes making everyday different  the hours are unlimited
cons: hard to communicate to management  raises could be better   and patient safety needs to  be a must some older nurses lost their passion for  the d&a dual diagnosis  field and might need to move on

review_title: A great place to work, supportive management and administration
pros: Administrators and managers are always eager to listen and try to solve problems together. Healthcare is a tough industry; admin is doing a great job.
cons: Too much gossip but that's anywhere today. Compared to other hospitals/health systems, Eagleville is by far a better place in which to work. There are some RNs who try to spoil things but most staff take a long term view. Many staff have worked there a very long time because it is friendly and supportive.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Collegeville, PA
pros: I learned a lot of valuable information in my 9and a half years working as a MHT.
cons:
I found management to be very partial and unfair.  They will keep certain employees working
that have done definite things that would be immediate termination.  They do not treat their
employees with any respect or courtesy.  The pay is horrible and does not reward their staff
for being a dedicated employee.  The workload was unrealistic and proved to be very unsafe
for the patients.

review_title: Laid back job with good direction from supervisors.
job_title: Weekend Program Assistant in Eagleville, PA
pros: It's a good place to get experience working with those suffering from addictions. Good direction from supervisors.
cons: Having to use split second decisions when confronted by patients.

review_title: I was employed 30 years . I found it to be wonderful organization!
pros: Good staff ,very caring people, family oriented
cons: Stressors associated with difficult patient population and managed care

pros: The people who work their
cons: Too restrictive with staff overall but it can be beneficial

pros: Excellent training and supervision opportunities.
cons: Some communication issues between departments.

pros: Fun place to work
cons: No cons on my end
